decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The building indicated on the approved plans as for non-food
    retail use shall be used only for this purpose and for no
    other purpose (including any other purpose within Class A1
    of the Schedule of the Town & Country Planning (Use Classes)
    Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that class in
    any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that
    order.

Condition : 2 - No more than 561 parking spaces shall be provided, of which
    28 shall be designed and designated for the use of people
    with disabilities.  Within the car park a central footway
    shall be provided with a minimum width of 2.5 metres, as
    shown on plan A250/T.

Condition : 3 - The development shall not open for trading until all
    roads, including the entrance junction, footways, cycleways,
    service road and parking areas have been laid out in
    accordance with a scheme submitted to and approved by the
    Council.

Condition : 4 - The development shall not open until a management scheme for
    the car park and servicing area has been submitted to and
    approved by the Council.

Condition : 5 - A minimum of 8 cycle parking stands shall be provided for
    staff and a minimum of 36 cycle parking stands for
    customers.

Condition : 6 - A bus stand and turnaround area shall be provided within the
    site.  In addition bus stops on the north and south sides of
    the access road shall be provided for buses accessing and
    egressing the site.

Condition : 7 - A bus stop and bay shall be provided for the Plus Bus
    vehicles as located on the approved plans

Condition : 8 - No servicing shall be carried out other than within the
    service areas within the curtilage of the site

Condition : 9 - Between the hours midnight to 7.00am Monday to Friday
    and 10.00pm and 8.00am Sunday and Bank Holidays no
    servicing shall take place for the non-food
    retail, the leisure or the restaurant use.
    Servicing to the supermarket will be
    restricted within the hours of midnight to
    7.00am to no more than four deliveries.

Condition : 10 - No music shall be played on the premises which is
    audible to adjacent residential premises.

Condition : 11 - A scheme with respect to control of :
    
    b.   The outstanding results of the contaminated
    land survey shall have been submitted to and a
    course of action agreed by the Council prior to the
    commencement of development.
    
    a.      :noise emission from the use of bottle banks
    on site, the provision of public and
    business recycling facilities, water
    collection and re-use on site, the control
    of air pollution shall be submitted to and
    approved by the Council prior to the
    commencement of development.

Condition : 12 - Full details of:
    lifts, toilets, cinema auditorium and
    associated circulation space will be
    submitted to and approved by the Council
    prior to the commencement of development.
    
    c.      the elevation of the restaurant adjacent to
    239 Finchley Road and to the elevational
    treatment of the curved roof in relation to
    the development fronting Finchley Road as a
    whole shall be submitted to and approved by
    
    the Council prior to the implementation of
    the development.
    a.      a scheme with respect to the provision of
    public toilets within the development will
    be submitted to and approved by the Council
    prior to commencement of the development.
    
    b.      A scheme with respect to the provision of
    access for disabled persons with respect to

Condition : 13 - a scheme showing an alternating arrangement to the proposed
    
    f.      hard and soft landscaping and means of
    enclosure of all unbuilt, open areas have
    been submitted to and approved by the
    Council prior to the commencement of
    development.
    steps to buildings fronting Finchley Road will be submitted
    to and approved by the Council prior to the commencement of
    development.
    
    e.      Samples of materials of all building works
    will be submitted to and approved by the
    Council prior to the commencement of
    development.

Condition : 14 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out
    seriously damaged or diseased, shall be
    replaced as soon as is reasonably possible
    and, in any case, by not later than the end
    of the following planting season, with
    others of similar size and species, unless
    the Council gives written consent to any
    variation.
    to a reasonable standard in accordance with
    the approved landscape details, prior to the
    occupation for the permitted use of the
    development or any phase of the development,
    whichever is the sooner.  Any trees or areas
    of planting which, within a period of 5
    years from the completion of the
    development, die, are removed or bcome

Condition : 15 - The applicant shall undertake best endevors to ensure that
    the length of Blackburn Road which is not publicly
    maintainable by the Highways Authority shall be kept free of
    parked vehicles at all times.

Condition : 16 - A working party shall be established comprising
    representatives from the owners of the development, their
    architects and contractors, relevant officers from the
    Environment Department, and residents living in adjoining
    dwellings.  The working party shall meet once a month to
    discuss issues relating to the demolition and construction
    of the new development.

Condition : 17 - To ensure that the future occupation of the building meets
    the requirement of policy to ensure that development which
    attracts a large number of trips located in areas of high
    transport accessibility.

Condition : 18 - To ensure that the use of the site does not add to further
    traffic congestion and to provide a convenient and safe
    pedestrian route through the car park.

Condition : 19 - In order that the Council is satisfied with the detailed
    design of the development.

Condition : 20 - To ensure that the development does not add further to
    traffic congestion.

Condition : 21 - To ensure that the Council's policy requirements with regard
    to the provision of cycle parking are satisfied.

Condition : 22 - To ensure that the Council's policy requirements with regard
    to the provision of cycle parking are satisfied.

Condition : 23 - To order that the Council is satisfied with the details of
    the scheme.

Condition : 24 - To ensure that the development does not result in traffic
    congestion in the surrounding streets.
Condition : 25 - To protect the amenity of residents of the surrouding area.
Condition : 26 - To protect the amenity of adjacent residential premises.

Condition : 29 - To ensure that the Council is satisfied with the landscape
    details and usual appearance of the development.
Condition : 30 - To ensure a clear emergency access to the site at all times.

Condition : 31 - To ensure that the development of the site is carried
    out to the satisfaction of the Council.

Condition : 32 - Under the terms of the Water Resources Act 1991, the prior
    5500 for details.
    written consent of the National Rivers Authority is required
    for any discharge of sewage or trade effluent into
    controlled waters (eg watercourses and underground waters),
    and may be required for any discharge of surface water to
    such controlled waters or for any discharge of sewage or
    trade effluent from buildings or fixed plant into or onto
    ground or into waters which are not controlled waters.  Such
    consent may be withheld.  Contact Mr D. DeCoster on 0181 310

Condition : 33 - Under the terms of the Water Resources Act 1991, the prior
    written consent of the National Rivers Authority Thames
    Region is currently required for any discharge or sewage or
    trade effluent onto or into ground and for surface runoff
    into groundwater.  Such consent may be withheld.  If there
    is an existing discharge consent the applicant should ensure
    that any increase in volume is permitted under the present
    conditions.  Contact Ms A Szabados on 01483 577655 for
    details.

Condition : 34 - To undertake highway improvements to construct an access to
    the site in accordance with the scheme drawn up by Colin
    Buchanan and partners and shown on drawing No: 4/61/4P/H,
    subject to the completion of an appropriate Section 278
    agreement with eh Highways Agency.

Condition : 35 - To ensure that the access to the site is to the satisfaction
    of the Council.
description:
Redevelopment of land  to the rear of 241-279 Finchley Road
by the erection of a 3 storey development comprising a mix
of retail, leisure and restaurant use and a Sainsbury's food
store fronting Finchley Road, and by the erection of a non
food retail store to the rear, together with the formation
of a new access road and traffic light controlled junction
with Finchley Road and the provision of a surface level car
park for 561 cars.
as shown on drawing no(s) A201J. A202J, A203J, A204J, A205,
230/04A, A302C, A301C, A401J, A402, A403, A220/A/B, 230/05A
4761/4P/H, 12073/18A, 12073/20B, A/500, A250/T, 12073/24.
